thread.title: Emmerdale is not on tonight but it's not all bad news | Metro News
thread.title_full: Emmerdale is not on tonight but it's not all bad news | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Emmerdale is not on tonight but it's not all bad news | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 10:57 am 
Sorry Emmerdale fans, but you are going to have to do without your usual Wednesday fix of drama tonight as the Brit Awards ceremony is replacing your favourite soap – but have no fear, as ITV are making it up to us all tomorrow with a bumper 90 minutes of Dales action. 
The Brits will see Coronation Street moved into Emmerdale’s usual 7pm slot, meaning that the episode, which will see Aaron Dingle jailed, will be moved to 7pm on Thursday. Thursday’s double, meanwhile, will air at 8pm for one hour in an episode focusing on Debbie contemplating sneaking through passport control to take Sarah Sugden to Prague. 
While it might be a bit of a frustration not to have our Emmerdale fix, we could use the night off to bask in the Robron joy brought by Maxine Alderton’s wedding episode yesterday – before it all falls apart when Aaron is sentenced. 
We’ve seen the next episode and, trust us, you might need this extra night to prepare for the emotion. 
So to summarise, Emmerdale airs next on Thursday 23rd February at 7pm and then for one hour at 8pm. Coronation Street airs tonight (Wednesday 22nd) at the earlier time of 7pm before the Brit Awards 2017 kick off at 7:30pm. 
Sorted!
